edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Interface JobRef

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JobSender

    public interface JobRef
    Interface JobRef specifies the interface for invoking a Job.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void heartbeatFromTask(long taskID)
      Tell this job that the given task is still alive.
      void heartbeatFromTracker()
      Tell this job that the tracker is still alive.

      Returns the host at which this job is listening for connections.

    • Method Detail

      • jobLaunched

        void jobLaunched(long jobID)
                 throws IOException
        Tell this job that the job launched.
        Parameters:
        jobID - Job ID.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • jobStarted

        void jobStarted()
                throws IOException
        Tell this job that the job started.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • taskLaunching

        void taskLaunching(long taskID,
                 int[] devnum,
                 boolean runInJobProcess)
                   throws IOException
        Tell this job that the given task is launching.
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        devnum - Array of GPU device numbers the task is allowed to use (must be non-null).
        runInJobProcess - True to run the task in the job's process, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • taskLaunched

        void taskLaunched(BackendRef backend,
                long taskID,
                String name)
                  throws IOException
        Tell this job that the given task was launched on the given backend.
        Parameters:
        backend - Backend.
        taskID - Task ID.
        name - Name of the node where the task is running.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • takeTuple

        void takeTuple(long taskID,
             long requestID,
             Tuple template,
             boolean blocking,
             boolean taking)
               throws IOException
        Tell this job to take a tuple that matches the given template out of tuple space.
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        requestID - Request ID.
        template - Template.
        blocking - True for a blocking take or read, false for a non-blocking take or read.
        taking - True to take a tuple, false to read a tuple.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • writeTuple

        void writeTuple(long taskID,
              Tuple tuple,
              int copies)
                throws IOException
        Tell this job to write the given tuple into tuple space.
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        tuple - Tuple.
        copies - Number of copies to write (1 or more).
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • taskFinished

        void taskFinished(long taskID)
                  throws IOException
        Tell this job that the given task finished.
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • taskFailed

        void taskFailed(long taskID,
              Throwable exc)
                throws IOException
        Tell this job that the given task failed.
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        exc - Exception that was thrown.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • heartbeatFromTracker

        void heartbeatFromTracker()
                          throws IOException
        Tell this job that the tracker is still alive.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • heartbeatFromTask

        void heartbeatFromTask(long taskID)
                       throws IOException
        Tell this job that the given task is still alive.

      • writeStandardStream

        void writeStandardStream(int stream,
                       int len,
                       byte[] data)
                         throws IOException
        Write the given data to the standard output or standard error stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - 0 to write to standard output, 1 to write to standard error.
        len - Length of data.
        data - Data buffer.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • host

        String host()
        Returns the host at which this job is listening for connections.

        Note: This method does not do a remote invocation.

        Returns:
        Host name.

      • port

        int port()
        Returns the port at which this job is listening for connections.

        Note: This method does not do a remote invocation.

        Returns:
        Port number.

      • jobFailed

        void jobFailed(Throwable exc)
        Tell this job that the whole job failed.

        Note: This method does not do a remote invocation.

        Parameters:
        exc - Exception that was thrown.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Gracefully shut down communication with the far end. The shutdown() method blocks until the far end acknowledges that communication was shut down.

      • terminate

        void terminate()
        Forcibly terminate communication with the far end. The terminate() method returns immediately, without waiting for an acknowledgment from the far end.
